revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-08 22:06:30.000000000', 'message': 'Validate identity providers during token validation

Previously, it was possible to validate a federated keystone token
after the identity provider associated by that token was deleted,
which is a security concern.

This commit does two things. First it makes it so that the token
cache is invalidated when identity providers are deleted. Second,
it validates the identity provider in the token data and ensures it
actually exists in the system before considering the token valid.

Change-Id: I57491c5a7d657b25cc436452acd7fcc4cd285839
Closes-Bug: 1291157

commit_message:
Validate identity providers during token validation

Previously, it was possible to validate a federated keystone token
after the identity provider associated by that token was deleted,
which is a security concern.

This commit does two things. First it makes it so that the token
cache is invalidated when identity providers are deleted. Second,
it validates the identity provider in the token data and ensures it
actually exists in the system before considering the token valid.

Change-Id: I57491c5a7d657b25cc436452acd7fcc4cd285839
Closes-Bug: 1291157

commit_message:
Finish refactoring self.*_api out of tests

A previous change started remove the self magic:

  Ic2094dca56158d8e4cd843eadff837f3a17ea38f

This commit finishes that work. A subsequent patch will remove the
self manager logic all together and we'll fix up any trivial test
infrastructure then.

Change-Id: Iedbde34ef5aa84905fd6b5f2297bf7f46dd7d278

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-04 15:51:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add late server group policy check to rebuild

The affinity and anti-affinity server group policy is enforced by the
scheduler but two parallel scheduling could cause that such policy is
violated. During instance boot a late policy check was performed in
the compute manager to pervent this. This check was missing in case
of rebuild. Therefore two parallel evacuate command could cause that
the server group policy is violated. This patch introduces the late
policy check to rebuild to prevent such situation. When the violation
is detected during boot a re-scheduling happens. However the rebuild
action does not have the re-scheduling implementation so in this case
the rebuild will fail and the evacuation needs to be retried by the
user.

Change-Id: I752617066bb2167b49239ab9d17b0c89754a3e12
Closes-Bug: #1735407

commit_message:
Add late server group policy check to rebuild

The affinity and anti-affinity server group policy is enforced by the
scheduler but two parallel scheduling could cause that such policy is
violated. During instance boot a late policy check was performed in
the compute manager to prevent this. This check was missing in case
of rebuild. Therefore two parallel evacuate command could cause that
the server group policy is violated. This patch introduces the late
policy check to rebuild to prevent such situation. When the violation
is detected during boot a re-scheduling happens. However the rebuild
action does not have the re-scheduling implementation so in this case
the rebuild will fail and the evacuation needs to be retried by the
user. Still this is better than allowing a parallel evacuation to
break the server group affinity policy.

To make the late policy check possible in the compute/manager the
rebuild_instance compute RPC call was extended with a request_spec
parameter.

Co-Authored-By: Richard Zsarnoczai <richard.zsarnoczai@ericsson.com>

Change-Id: I752617066bb2167b49239ab9d17b0c89754a3e12
Closes-Bug: #1735407

commit_message:
conf: Rename '[neutron] ovs_bridge'

Add a 'default_' prefix to better clarify the purpose of this option.

Change-Id: Ibd576686c372661693e4838562fb3deb7878dff6
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-pike

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ifa118da08951612d73721f04123dc39daf48323b

commit_message:
Fix non-venv keystone handling

Turns out we were not installing two items that are
regardless of being in a venv, however we were installing
only when a venv was defined, and as a result the job
was failing in certian ci test cases since keystone
has not been previously required to be used by any
job.

Change-Id: I27358add99ab40c988627f2362e0f07c2324c670

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I59b7341bc273ee87e06302c290d16f97d99aa708

commit_message:
Fix upper-constraints use

Upper contrains use has been lacking on some of the
module installs, resulting in occassional issues
being encountered.

Apply the upper constraints file to our pip install
usage.

Change-Id: I877650a094be442218e5f7310037cfb9a523791f
Closes-Bug: #1675808

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I3d46be54b3dc419e14d954a2d3eb00d5219be1d9

commit_message:
Add regression test for bug 1735407

Parallel evacuation can violate server group policy. This patch adds
functional test to recreate the bug.

The _wait_for_migration_status helper needed to be moved upper in the
test calls hierarchy so it can be reused for this test too.

Change-Id: I5bc50f9c0913a5b02c42f4ab201e9bf097395b54
Related-Bug: #1735407

commit_message:
Fix the format file name

The file name should be marked follow [1]
as consistent with their semantic meaning.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/doc-contrib-guide/rst-conv/inline-markups.html#file-name-and-path

Change-Id: Ic18d0563412650d3b42c2ed5c07e69f309877cb9

commit_message:
Remove instance.keypairs migration code

This was all added in Newton to prepare for moving
keypairs to the API database. The 345 nova DB migration
in Ocata forced people to run the online data migrations
to move keypairs out of the nova (cell) database to the
nova_api database. When they ran those data migrations,
they'd also be migrating instance.keypairs into the
instance_extra table.

At this point we can remove all of this migration code.

Change-Id: Ie83e7bd807c2c79e5cbe1337292c2d1989d4ac03

commit_message:
libvirt: fix native luks encryption failure to find volume_id

Not all volume types put a 'volume_id' entry in the
connection_info['data'] dict. This change uses a new
utility method to look up the volume_id in the connection_info
data dict and if not found there, uses the 'serial' value
from the connection_info, which we know at least gets set
when the DriverVolumeBlockDevice code attaches the volume.

This also has to update pre_live_migration since the connection_info
dict doesn't have a 'volume_id' key in it. It's unclear what
this code was expecting, or if it ever really worked, but since
an attached volume represented by a BlockDeviceMapping here has
a volume_id attribute, we can just use that. As that code path
was never tested, this updates related unit tests and refactors
the tests to actually use the type of DriverVolumeBlockDevice
objects that the ComputeManager would be sending down to the
driver pre_live_migration method. The hard-to-read squashed
dicts in the tests are also re-formatted so a human can actually
read them.

Change-Id: Ie02d298cd92d5b5ebcbbcd2b0e8be01f197bfafb
Closes-Bug: #1746609

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I40ddb03770349ec90ec0d994237cff2e871fd6cb

commit_message:
Collect logs to a subfolder properly

The backport of https://review.openstack.org/522794
was incomplete, resulting in the logs still being
put in the same folder as the zuul logs, mixing
everything up and overwriting the ARA report.

This patch completes the backport properly.

Change-Id: Id75d24812019d7f35f2f674cdf8b00222ddbd6ce

commit_message:
Remove heat-api-cloudwatch service support

In 6d55417f80384ead56e176beec9e2fc4eb162d61 cloudwatch api
has been removed from heat. This has been deprecated/disabled
in Pike by default. So good to remove it's support Queens.

Change-Id: I704631456eb1f791c6f2290d8feb7b82cae92579

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-19 08:46:38.000000000', 'message': 'Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=1.12.0

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on python
3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone information
instead of its own implementation. This does not change direct date
handling, but when converting this value there is a slight difference
where now python 2.x will show UTC times as "UTC", but on python 3
they will end up with "UTC+00:00".

The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match on
"UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values

Change-Id: Ia5e341f8ca751a9569ab9735a64509d6cfce44b2
Closes-bug: #1744160
'}, {'created': '2018-01-19 10:16:13.000000000', 'message': 'Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=1.12.0

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on python
3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone information
instead of its own implementation. This does not change direct date
handling, but when converting this value there is a slight difference
where now python 2.x will show UTC times as "UTC", but on python 3
they will end up with "UTC+00:00".

The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match on
"UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values

Change-Id: Ia5e341f8ca751a9569ab9735a64509d6cfce44b2
Closes-bug: #1744160
'}, {'created': '2018-01-24 04:16:45.000000000', 'message': 'Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=0.1.12

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on python
3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone information
instead of its own implementation. This does not change direct date
handling, but when converting this value there is a slight difference
where now python 2.x will show UTC times as "UTC", but on python 3
they will end up with "UTC+00:00".

The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match on
"UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values

Change-Id: Ia5e341f8ca751a9569ab9735a64509d6cfce44b2
Closes-bug: #1744160
'}]
commit_message:
Handle TZ change in iso8601 >=0.1.12

The iso8601 lib introduced a change such that if running on python
3.2 or later it internally uses the python timezone information
instead of its own implementation. This does not change direct date
handling, but when converting this value there is a slight difference
where now python 2.x will show UTC times as "UTC", but on python 3
they will end up with "UTC+00:00".

The to_primitive call for DateTime fields was doing an exact match on
"UTC" to determine whether to include "Z" in the resulting string.
This updates that handling to recognize either of the new values

Change-Id: Ia5e341f8ca751a9569ab9735a64509d6cfce44b2
Closes-bug: #1744160

commit_message:
Ensure neutron agents & rabbitmq do not restart when upgrading

This change adds neutron_agent and rabbitmq_all groups to the upgrade
process to ensure new container config does not cause these two
container types to restart.

> While the neutron_agents services have been moved on-to baremetal,
  the old container types will still exist and will have an active
  workload on them. Ensureing we guard against container restarts
  for these services will help deployers maximize uptime during the P>Q
  upgrade.

Change-Id: Ia9cfd8693af3ff2077638dd3c3935b9fec48a4c2
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Lowering the number of ansible forks to 25

With forks set to 50, we can see upwards of 20GB RSS memory used on the
undercloud (depdning on the size of the overcloud). To reduce this, and
the chance for Ansible to run out of memory, I am recommending to update
this to 25.

To see the impact of forks set to 25:
https://snapshot.raintank.io/dashboard/snapshot/gseMLc1opbSueaY91tcjjbH9Lub2tnBm?orgId=2

Change-Id: I7c57b641aa7fea02f865778321c98d1dd3d7e085
Closes-Bug: 1740880
(cherry picked from commit I7c57b641aa7fea02f865778321c98d1dd3d7e085)

commit_message:
Fixes mistral-server --version command

This patch changes the call into oslo_config to pass the string
containing the version instead of passing the version module.

Change-Id: I698d7206c195f1762dfbadb78c599c60be7f310b
Fixes-bug: 1717869

commit_message:
Changing logging to oslo_log

The oslo.log lib provides standardized log functions for all opentack
projects. It is better to use the common logging module instead of logging

Change-Id: I7faa95c58a83f76cc72f65edabd57034641a6377

commit_message:
Replace curly quotes with straight quotes

Curly quotes usually input from Chinese input method.
When read from english context, it makes some confusion.

Change-Id: I84dc5e45522b1c8f6f3174f6ee855b4ed37be709

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Add custom_vrrp_script param to keepalived

This is needed when running keepalived in a container in
order provide a containerish version of the command to check
if haproxy is running.

Change-Id: I800d5c067a57b0ed7f15397a1f655fbd88a4633e

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I3d00ed0cbf13e012d5ace5a920474886d8d35b33

commit_message:
Revert "Set disable:true for oci-machine-register"

We don't need this code anymore, since it's now the default
in OCI, since:
https://github.com/projectatomic/oci-register-machine/commit/66691c3d0805c41e7336a364934e3e144e97a20f#diff-7a73afad76bf813b4d03daf6fbc18568

This reverts commit e9bce747833af94ce71fe76921bd53cb5df07964.

Closes-Bug: #1747473
Change-Id: Iddc8a35a20a745dba14456e4b57741ffec67cc80
(cherry picked from commit 0674a2e2930f49d095ad61bf50ac1b4616592d65)

Thanks for your work.

I see an issue with this approach. We just passing scaling policy cooldown value to asg, and then calculate whether the scaling in progress on the mixed data: cooldown from scaling policy and date of last update from asg. An example where this will works incorrectly:
Working with several scaling policies attached to the same asg.
Assume you have 2 policies with such cooldowns: 0, 120 and asg cooldown 0.
Performs scaling by (2) policy, wait 120 secs, perform (1) scaling policy and (2) again. The last scaling won't be performed because of cooldown 120."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2016-03-28 17:17:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Thanks, good point.I'll change to have the scaling allowed check only in policy rather than the group."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2016-03-28 18:14:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2016-03-29 06:12:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-03-29 06:53:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Verified-1

@oleskii:

After thinking through the issue, I think the existing approach is not good either.
		
Taking an example with the existing code:
	Policy 1: Cooldown 10
	Policy 2: Cooldown 100
	Group: Cooldown 0
		
After create, if you use policy 2 and scale. Then if you immediately use policy 1, it would not allow for any cooldown from the first scaling.
		
IMO, cooldown is there for the 'group' to stabilize after a scaling activity. If you use several policies one after the other then the  behaviour can be erratic.

IMO, the approach I proposed is better than existing one, where we control the cooldown with the group. This can be further improved to have more metadata in the future to have better behaviour."}, {'account_id': 12363, 'date': '2016-03-29 12:43:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Rabi, I have one more example that works incorrectly with your old approach:
if we have asg without cooldown, create it and then sending signal to some scaling policy with a (huge) cooldown, we skeep such scaling because of scaling policy cooldown. But this is wrong, imho.'}, {'account_id': 12363, 'date': '2016-03-29 12:44:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

skeep->skip*'}, {'account_id': 12363, 'date': '2016-03-29 12:46:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

Also i would prefer to keep existing behaviour, because we don't know for sure how user uses scaling policy/asg."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2016-03-29 13:20:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

>if we have asg without cooldown, create it and then sending signal to some scaling policy with a (huge) cooldown, we skeep such scaling because of scaling policy cooldown. But this is wrong, imho

Nope, that's correct . cooldown period is not something arbitrary that someone can set as they wish. It should have a dependency on the group size and scale of adjustment.

Also, after create, there should be some cooldown as the servers need to be up and running for sometime to provide metric for the alarm/signal.

Probably this is something we'll discuss with others to get a consensus."}, {'account_id': 12363, 'date': '2016-03-29 13:40:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

>>Nope, that's correct . cooldown period is not something arbitrary that someone can set as they wish. It should have a dependency on the group size and scale of adjustment.
That's why scaling policy and asg have different cooldowns. And we have calculate cooldown_in_progress starting from the date of update that was caused by this particular scaling policy but not on a mixed data. Also, the example that i mentioned above should work: assume that you have some asg with 1 instance inside and scaling policy with some huge scaling_adjustment. So why we need to wait the cooldown seconds for scaling policy rather than from asg itself?"}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2016-04-01 06:13:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-04-01 07:22:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Verified-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-03-17 13:38:11.000000000', 'message': "Don't resize when the capacity is the same

It seems we're calling resize and sending notifications
for the ASG when max or min size has been already reached.

Change-Id: I241a32b52e0708264c80c3eca313a97534927415
Related-Bug: #1555748
"}, {'created': '2016-03-18 09:01:20.000000000', 'message': "Don't resize when the capacity is the same

It seems we're calling resize and sending notifications
for the ASG auto scaling when max or min size has already
been reached.

Also, current behaviour when update is issued and scaling
is happening(via alarm) the update gets stuck in IN_PROGRESS.

This patch changes it to go ahead and update it irrespective
of scale-up/down.

Change-Id: I241a32b52e0708264c80c3eca313a97534927415
Related-Bug: #1555748
"}, {'created': '2016-03-18 09:13:13.000000000', 'message': "Don't resize when the capacity is the same

It seems we're calling resize and sending notifications
for the ASG auto scaling when max or min size has already
been reached.

Also, current behaviour when update is issued and scaling
is happening(via alarm) the update gets stuck in IN_PROGRESS.

This patch changes it to go ahead and update it irrespective
of scale-up/down.

Change-Id: I241a32b52e0708264c80c3eca313a97534927415
Related-Bug: #1555748
"}, {'created': '2016-03-18 11:43:19.000000000', 'message': "Don't resize when the capacity is the same

It seems we're calling resize and sending notifications
for the ASG auto scaling when max or min size has already
been reached.

Also, current behaviour when update is issued and scaling
is happening(via alarm) the update gets stuck in IN_PROGRESS.

This patch changes it to go ahead and update it irrespective
of scale-up/down.

Change-Id: I241a32b52e0708264c80c3eca313a97534927415
Related-Bug: #1555748
"}, {'created': '2016-03-19 10:01:20.000000000', 'message': "Fix some autoscaling issues

- Fix update stuck in  IN_PROGRESS if issued within
the cooldown preiod after CREATE_COMPLETE.

- Fix update stuck in IN_PROGRESS if issued when scaling
is happening.

- Don't allow scaling when stack status in not COMPLETE.

- Allow update irrespective of scaling activity.

- Don't resize and send notifications when max/min size
has reached for the group i.e.max/nin has been reached.

- Remove the duplicate usage of CooldownMixin by both
ASG and ScalingPolicy.

Change-Id: I241a32b52e0708264c80c3eca313a97534927415
Related-Bug: #1555748
"}, {'created': '2016-03-19 18:06:20.000000000', 'message': 'Remove multiple use of cooldownMixin

Remove the duplicate usage of CooldownMixin by both
ASG and ScalingPolicy.

Change-Id: I241a32b52e0708264c80c3eca313a97534927415
Related-Bug: #1555748
'}, {'created': '2016-03-19 19:33:51.000000000', 'message': 'Remove multiple use of cooldownMixin

Change-Id: I241a32b52e0708264c80c3eca313a97534927415
Related-Bug: #1555748
'}, {'created': '2016-04-01 06:13:04.000000000', 'message': 'Remove multiple use of CooldownMixin

Remove the unnecessary duplicate usage of CooldownMixin
by both ASG and ScalingPolicy.

Set metadata with the cooldown end timestmap rather than
the current timestamp when scaling is finished. So the
next scaling activity can check whether the earlier cooldown
has finished or not.

This also moves the CooldownMixin tests to the group test
modules.

Change-Id: I241a32b52e0708264c80c3eca313a97534927415
Related-Bug: #1555748
'}, {'created': '2016-04-01 12:44:09.000000000', 'message': 'Remove multiple use of CooldownMixin

commit_message:
Remove use of CooldownMixin with scaling policy

Removes the multiple use of the mixin, so that we don't
set metadata for both policy and group. Setting the cooldown
metadata only for group would suffice.

Change-Id: I241a32b52e0708264c80c3eca313a97534927415
Related-Bug: #1555748

commit_message:
Remove use of unsupported TEMPEST_SERVICES variable

TEMPEST_SERVICES global variable is not supported
by devstack since long back.
- I380dd20e5ed716a0bdf92aa02c3730359b8136e4
- I9c24705e494689f09a885eb0a640efd50db33fcf

Service availability of tempest known services will be
set by devstack with local check.
- I02be777bf93143d946ccbb8e9eff637bfd1928d4

This commit removes the unused TEMPEST_SERVICES setting
Related-Bug: #1743688

Change-Id: I610527a56f13662ed6f10ae429d670f864582b33

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ib9bbcecfaf561089bd31dccc79b7ef5119134244

commit_message:
Deprecate usage of tenant and user in context

Update usage of tenant to project_id and user to user_id when handling context
fields. This drops deprecation warnings.

Change-Id: I8001be34bcc25678ed99b6b6717ad170ae6d2d77

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Add new image_filter_project_id param for dashboard

A new parameter MURANO_IMAGE_FILTER_PROJECT_ID was added to the
dashboard configuration in review:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/504833/

This commit adds a new class parameter 'image_filter_project_id' to
the dashboard class to set this parameter.

Change-Id: I0055c8941f14e5b6c3338689ec15f6b260b31229

commit_message:
Add a prelude section for Pike

Our release notes are read by a lot of people and we somehow need
to summarize the top main changes that are in that release for Nova.
Audience is targeted to be general and not really dev-oriented.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I65cfb6e22597edfeda687fc2f0c5ae5e098aa950

commit_message:
mongodb: avoid duplicated resources in systemd config

The unit directory for mongodb service in systemd is already managed by
puppet-systemd. This patch will ensure that puppet-tripleo doesn't
manage the resource anymore and actually rely on it for orchestration
with a "require" statement.

Change-Id: Id030896250117dcc0eb6c4f5a7b8d8aa4d265fa5
Closes-Bug: #1747533

commit_message:
Create static routes for remote subnets

Add static routes to reach remote subnets via
router connected to locale ctlplane segment.

Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-ironic-inspector
Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment
Change-Id: Ibfc4c1492377ea4c3966ffadfd440bd705c45d19

commit_message:
[WIP] Python 3 fix and flake8 cleanup

This patch fixes some flake8 errors and ensures that the `Queue`
python module can be used properly under python 2 and 3.

Change-Id: I3c13bfe66fe003ba6b56593c02092c9ff17c3659

commit_message:
roles: bifrost-ironic-install: Download the iPXE loader file

We are chaining to the PXE loader file instead of loading it as a kernel
image so we should download the ipxe.pxe file instead of the ipxe.lkrn
one

Fixes: I1f07e91ab109d1e59a377f1561a42fa9c0129405
Change-Id: Ica768cf304db9ed6abdb98976dceee5f04f3eac2

commit_message:
Add support for multiple inspection subnets

Configure Inspector with the required tags and
per-subnet dhcp router options to enable
inspection of nodes reaching the undercloud via
DHCP-relay on remote networks.

Change-Id: Iba1cadf1d6eef6ba6c028f4ba1689da95047ccea

commit_message:
Update config to use per network groups

Use groups to specify control plane network data. When
we do routed networks we need to provide network data
for each controlplane network/subnet.

Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-ironic-inspector
Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-deployment
Change-Id: Ia95ff5c00433c89155727ea5551904c45197e6b0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-24 21:54:20.000000000', 'message': "Use on-marked-down shutdown-sessions for redis haproxy conf

The problem we have with redis can be described as follows:
- Connection is made to redis via haproxy, where haproxy directs to one redis node
- That chosen redis node fails and a new redis node gets promoted
- HAProxy will send *new* connections to redis to the newly promoted
  redis server, but you still have a session active (ie. that has not hit
  timeout), so haproxy will attempt to use that connection.

By using 'on-marked-down shutdown-sessions' we make sure we close
old existing sessions when the redis master node changes.

NB: Cherry-pick not 100% clean due to some context differences

Closes-Bug: #1742086
Tested-By: Marian Krcmarik <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia4d8c27057ee2de9e49e4358aa069571d1c952a9

commit_message:
Use on-marked-down shutdown-sessions for redis haproxy conf

The problem we have with redis can be described as follows:
- Connection is made to redis via haproxy, where haproxy directs to one redis node
- That chosen redis node fails and a new redis node gets promoted
- HAProxy will send *new* connections to redis to the newly promoted
  redis server, but you still have a session active (ie. that has not hit
  timeout), so haproxy will attempt to use that connection.

By using 'on-marked-down shutdown-sessions' we make sure we close
old existing sessions when the redis master node changes.

NB: Cherry-pick not 100% clean due to some context differences

Closes-Bug: #1742086
Tested-By: Marian Krcmarik <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia4d8c27057ee2de9e49e4358aa069571d1c952a9
(cherry picked from commit dbfc8e1c1d5f39c7e64de7d7188cb2325492ee2a)
(cherry picked from commit 3eebb0b00b06dd8f57d8f17d5b822d7346b6d2f2)
(cherry picked from commit 507fd3a69fbe85ff3c1eac45ad1b88cc70769157)

commit_message:
Use on-marked-down shutdown-sessions for redis haproxy conf

The problem we have with redis can be described as follows:
- Connection is made to redis via haproxy, where haproxy directs to one redis node
- That chosen redis node fails and a new redis node gets promoted
- HAProxy will send *new* connections to redis to the newly promoted
  redis server, but you still have a session active (ie. that has not hit
  timeout), so haproxy will attempt to use that connection.

By using 'on-marked-down shutdown-sessions' we make sure we close
old existing sessions when the redis master node changes.

NB: Cherry-pick not 100% clean due to some context differences

Closes-Bug: #1742086
Tested-By: Marian Krcmarik <mkrcmari@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ia4d8c27057ee2de9e49e4358aa069571d1c952a9

commit_message:
Add Panko expirer class

This sets up a cron task to run periodically and
expire panko events in db.

Change-Id: I23359239008105cd77a599d2c08c067f132099b7
Partial-Bug: #1746514

subject: Adding Dougal Matthews candidacy for Mistral
messages:
[{'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-02-06 09:05:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-06 13:34:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I can't find any OpenStack Foundation Individual Membership associated with any of the E-mail addresses linked to your Gerrit account, and even searching the foundation member database for you by name isn't returning any matching results (perhaps you have a lapsed membership due to failure to vote in two consecutive board of directors elections?). Please see my announcement from last year with instructions to make sure you are an OpenStack Foundation Individual Member in good standing:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-July/119786.html

Once you (re)join the foundation and make sure to list at least one E-mail address you're using with Gerrit in your individual member profile, please comment on this review and we'll be happy to check again."}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-02-06 15:23:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Jeremy, thanks for that. I was only a community member before, I guess that was the issue. I have switched to be a foundation member. Thanks for you help.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-06 18:36:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

candidacy has been checked and is valid for this team'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2018-02-06 18:36:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Candidacy is valid.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-02-06 18:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
tests: test-neutron-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

Change-Id: I937b74179f448c3f7d5a93098fb4d2440d105550

don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

commit_message:
tests: test-cinder-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

Change-Id: I6e6a232a213f0951f3d5fff8b4efac5898ce6d76

commit_message:
tests: test-nova-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

Change-Id: I03ad2ae6ded9e13052980694d1122169c1374bb0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-11 21:56:07.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] This commit provides additional flexibility for the calico chart

* Ingests the bird templates so that we can override them
to support things such as custom BGP ports (listen) and
neighbors (remote)
* Introduces a new job to perform calicoctl manipulation to
support manipulating the mesh, adding peers, and changing the
ipPool settings which is value driven
* Support custom port binding and specific interface binding
to allow custom BGP port selection for IPv4 and IPv6
* Instantiates calicoctl as a utility on hosts
* Adds a new function to helm-toolkit to retrieve the http
or https prefix for an endpoint

This patchset is missing https support for etcd (pending)

Change-Id: Ib4d00befddbd8498b9dcc693409b8b2577458497
'}, {'created': '2018-01-11 21:57:33.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] This commit provides additional flexibility for the calico chart

* Ingests the bird templates so that we can override them
to support things such as custom BGP ports (listen) and
neighbors (remote)
* Supports announcing addresses that are within the
.Values.networking.bgp.ipv4|6.additional_cidrs list.
* Introduces a new job to perform calicoctl manipulation to
support manipulating the mesh, adding peers, and changing the
ipPool settings which is value driven
* Support custom port binding and specific interface binding
to allow custom BGP port selection for IPv4 and IPv6
* Instantiates calicoctl as a utility on hosts
* Adds a new function to helm-toolkit to retrieve the http
or https prefix for an endpoint

This patchset is missing https support for etcd (pending)

Change-Id: Ib4d00befddbd8498b9dcc693409b8b2577458497

* Adds a new function to helm-toolkit to retrieve the http

* Supports https based etcd backends with new certificate
parameters

    ingress controllers that can create dummy interfaces and assign
    addresses to be announced

  * Introduces a new job to perform calicoctl manipulation to support
    manipulating the mesh, adding peers, and changing the ipPool
    settings which is value driven

  * Support custom port binding and specific interface binding to
    allow custom BGP port selection for IPv4 and IPv6

  * Instantiates calicoctl as a utility on hosts

  * Adds a new function to helm-toolkit to retrieve the http or https
    prefix for an endpoint

  * Supports https based etcd backends with new certificate parameters

  * Finally, introduces more strict bgp listening to allow multiple
    hostNet bgp speakers to run in parallel

Change-Id: Ib4d00befddbd8498b9dcc693409b8b2577458497

commit_message:
Provide additional flexibility for the calico chart

* Ingests the bird templates so that we can override them
to support things such as custom BGP ports (listen) and
neighbors (remote)

* Supports announcing addresses that are within the
.Values.networking.bgp.ipv4|6.additional_cidrs list
in support of ingress controllers that can create
dummy interfaces and assign addresses to be announced

* Introduces a new job to perform calicoctl manipulation to
support manipulating the mesh, adding peers, and changing the
ipPool settings which is value driven

* Support custom port binding and specific interface binding
to allow custom BGP port selection for IPv4 and IPv6

* Instantiates calicoctl as a utility on hosts

* Adds a new function to helm-toolkit to retrieve the http
or https prefix for an endpoint

* Supports https based etcd backends with new certificate
parameters

* Finally, introduces more strict bgp listening to allow
multiple hostNet bgp speakers to run in parallel

Change-Id: Ib4d00befddbd8498b9dcc693409b8b2577458497

commit_message:
Add the nova-multiattach job

This change adds a new voting check/gate queue job for running
volume multiattach compute API tests.

This configures devstack to enable tempest for volume multiattach
support and disables the Pike UCA since we need qemu<2.10 for
libvirt to work with multiattach volumes.

Depends on the following devstack patch to add the
ENABLE_VOLUME_MULTIATTACH variable. The devstack patch
depends on the tempest patch that adds the volume multiattach
tests and the tempest patch depends on the series of nova
changes that add volume multiattach support.

Depends-On: I46b7eabf6a28f230666f6933a087f73cb4408348

Depends on the following nova patch to fix a bug when
creating a server snapshot of a paused instance when not
using the Pike UCA:

Depends-On: If6c4dd6890ad6e2d00b186c6a9aa85f507b354e0

Depends on the tip of the series of Tempest tests which include
additional tests for resize with a multiattach volume and swap
volume with a multiattach volume.

Depends-On: I751e9e4237e2997e102dd13c4f060deaea73d543

Part of blueprint multi-attach-volume

Change-Id: I51adbbdf13711e463b4d25c2ffd4a3123cd65675

commit_message:
Fix deployment_with_ha missing attribute

Currently the 'create ffu overcloud upgrade scripts' task fails with
'bool object' has no attribute 'rc'. This change fixes this issue by
using the correct conditional when creating the script file.

Change-Id: I70b41ab9121599302ad9590e7ae92dbe96d03310

commit_message:
hw ovs offload - On some machines representor ports not created after reboot

On some machines it's failing to run the devlink and ethtool commands
without the full path of these commands

Closes-Bug: #1745821
Change-Id: If2f7c7a46fb1b52cce9ffbfa31a3161fc07f1334

[{'created': '2018-02-01 16:32:35.000000000', 'message': 'Disable ceph-mgr dashboard module

The ceph-mgr dashboard is enabled by default and we do not want it
to, as it listens on 0.0.0.0:7000 and exposes sensible cluster
internals.

Change-Id: I9f0c9daec8209f7991400c7450f0e8f227bf0362
'}]
commit_message:
Disable ceph-mgr dashboard module

The ceph-mgr dashboard is enabled by default and we do not want it
to, as it listens on 0.0.0.0:7000 and exposes sensible cluster
internals.

Change-Id: I9f0c9daec8209f7991400c7450f0e8f227bf0362

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-26 16:30:53.000000000', 'message': 'cinder incremental backup with ceph fails if last one deleted

If the last incremental backup is deleted then the backup snapshot
is deleted but the source volume snapshot remains. Due to mismatch
between the source volume snapshot and backup snapshot, there is an
error when "rbd export-diff" and "rbd import-diff" is done. Hence,
full backup happens.

To fix this issue, all the previous source volume snapshots are
preserved. When the last incremental backup is deleted, then its
backup snapshot is deleted. But because all the source volume snaps
exist, thus it can now update --from-snap for "rbd export-diff" to
be the most recent source volume snapshot for which there exists a
backup snapshot as well. This is how the incremental backup operation
will go successful.

For a user who upgrades to the new code, if the last backup snapshot
and source volume snapshot are in sync, i.e. both of them exist, then
the next create backup operation will continue as an incremental one.
However, if there is no source volume snapshot for the last existing
incremental backup (before the code was upgraded), then a full backup
happens. After this full backup, all the next backups are incremental
while all their corresponding source volume snapshots are also preserved.
In this way, after a user upgrades, if he deletes the last incremental
backup, the next create backup operation will be successful and be
incremental.

Since all the backup snapshots exist for all the backups, if the user
wants to restore a backup, which was created before the code was upgraded,
the user will not lose any data since the same base backup is used.

Change-Id: Ia9c29bb720152d42bec273202fa49ca4b6a41ce2
Closes-Bug: #1703011
(cherry picked from commit bc9ab142da919087c71525978f960115ff0259b9)
'}]
commit_message:
cinder incremental backup with ceph fails if last one deleted

If the last incremental backup is deleted then the backup snapshot
is deleted but the source volume snapshot remains. Due to mismatch
between the source volume snapshot and backup snapshot, there is an
error when "rbd export-diff" and "rbd import-diff" is done. Hence,
full backup happens.

To fix this issue, all the previous source volume snapshots are
preserved. When the last incremental backup is deleted, then its
backup snapshot is deleted. But because all the source volume snaps
exist, thus it can now update --from-snap for "rbd export-diff" to
be the most recent source volume snapshot for which there exists a
backup snapshot as well. This is how the incremental backup operation
will go successful.

For a user who upgrades to the new code, if the last backup snapshot
and source volume snapshot are in sync, i.e. both of them exist, then
the next create backup operation will continue as an incremental one.
However, if there is no source volume snapshot for the last existing
incremental backup (before the code was upgraded), then a full backup
happens. After this full backup, all the next backups are incremental
while all their corresponding source volume snapshots are also preserved.
In this way, after a user upgrades, if he deletes the last incremental
backup, the next create backup operation will be successful and be
incremental.

Since all the backup snapshots exist for all the backups, if the user
wants to restore a backup, which was created before the code was upgraded,
the user will not lose any data since the same base backup is used.

Change-Id: Ia9c29bb720152d42bec273202fa49ca4b6a41ce2
Closes-Bug: #1703011

commit_message:
Remove BaseV*ImageAdminTest class

This commit removes BaseV1 and V2 ImageAdminTest classes. The usage
was removed in the previous commit[0]. So, we don't need to have these
class anymore.

[0] I9ccf070a12d24e63db5fb0f960c8be764b1b02dd

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

'}]
commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I074a157e3df18f3ea7ef6a63252b2a2f191133c9

'}, {'created': '2018-01-25 10:10:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for VNC TLS

Adds parameters to configure TLS for the nova novnc-proxy to libvirt/qemu

commit_message:
Add support for VNC TLS

Adds parameters to configure TLS for the nova novnc-proxy to libvirt/qemu
now the support has landed in nova (bp/websocket-proxy-to-host-security).

Change-Id: I24a9841ba04c95df27599b4d7ac2da8416e751e5

Fix linters tests

Systemd module must now be used when doing only daemon-reload to
avoid lint failures.

Change-Id: Ie20f3696b3ab8063321575fefb661fcdd22966f2

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I2d90d8d9c396f78ad9b981229d0741b71f59812d

commit_message:
Extracted HTTP response codes to constants

There are several places in the source code where HTTP response
codes are used as numeric values.

Status codes 200, 201, 202, 204, 300, 400, 401, 403, 404, 408, 409, 422
and 424 under volume/drivers are replaced with symbolic constants from
six.moves.http_client thus improves code readability.

Closes-Bug: #1520159
Change-Id: I6d0721588af1491139e0dee8d84e21638ec7febb

subject: Extracted HTTP response codes to constants

commit_message:
Extracted HTTP response codes to constants

There are several places in the drivers(dell_emc,hpe) where HTTP
response codes are used as numeric values.

Status codes 200, 400, 401, 403, 404, 409 and 500 under
tests/unit/volume/drivers(dell_emc,hpe) are replaced with symbolic
constants from six.moves.http_client thus improves code readability.
More patches will be submitted to address other status codes.

Partial-Bug: #1520159
Change-Id: I7fd0f1b5a1e15d718e407def2334ff7aea52c071

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/quest
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 19:54:19.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/quest

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I534f80cd7503971a12712d0b1142bb0badce6fe3
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/quest

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I534f80cd7503971a12712d0b1142bb0badce6fe3

commit_message:
fix the count error of chunked based volume backup

this bug is that the initial value of object_id is 1, and
the last addition was not used.so we change the initial
value of object_id is 0 and add addition before it be used to
make object_name start with object1

Change-Id: I08eecd77998c9b949238cdd9a686eae57d5dd683
Closes-Bug: #1701177

test for the source_execution option.

[{'created': '2018-02-05 15:37:49.000000000', 'message': "Don't copy ironic's policy.json sample

Since ironic change I10a4987204eb335f1fed29d4b1d7f3e075aa1792, the
sample policy.json is not present in the ironic repository. Since policy
is now in code, it is not required.

This change removes support for copying the sample policy file to
/etc/ironic.

Change-Id: Id0e8eb54b0d67ba1c522c6e76afad2b61059a621
"}]
commit_message:
Don't copy ironic's policy.json sample

Since ironic change I10a4987204eb335f1fed29d4b1d7f3e075aa1792, the
sample policy.json is not present in the ironic repository. Since policy
is now in code, it is not required.

This change removes support for copying the sample policy file to
/etc/ironic.

Change-Id: Id0e8eb54b0d67ba1c522c6e76afad2b61059a621

Turn off broken tests for now, so we can work on
fixing them one-by-one.

The new Swift/Manila content is good.

But according to latest spec about this, I guess JBI is only marked deprecated when APIv1 is deprecated. (That's because even if we marked JBI deprecated now, we couldn't remove it until APIv1 is removed entirely)"}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 01:36:48.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

* Verified-1 by Jenkins (3)
'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-02 14:43:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-02 15:03:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

I rebased the patch and rewritten the notes about the deprecation of job binary internal so that they shows that the feature is available in API v1.1 only.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-02-02 16:44:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

You could make the commit message slightly more accurate.

Also, do we think saying something is "only APIv1.1" is enough to imply that the feature will not be around forever?'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-02 16:56:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

About API v1.1: I think it implies that if you use something different (2.0) then it's not available. Also, this documentation will be changed again when 2.0 moves to stable and 1.1 to deprecated (at some point we will have both around, and we will likely have to keep both for some time)."}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-02-02 16:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23078, 'date': '2018-02-02 17:05:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8932, 'date': '2018-02-06 18:02:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
EDP doc: de-emphasize job binary internals (not in v2)

* Adding deprecation warning about job binary internals in the
  dashboard user guide
* Changing how deprecation warning is given at userdoc edp page
* Changing dashboard user guid job examples, now it uses swift
  as type storage for job binaries instead of internals

Change-Id: Ib1083ee6f6e204248e10f17b5ce58fd424e74106
Partial-Implements: bp remove-job-binary-internal

Is it really a bad thing that the call doesn't include a status?

Backups take a long time, unlike volume creation, which takes seconds, so in most cases the status will be "creating" and will need to be queried with further requests to see if it succeeded or not.

Is returning "creating" really providing value here?  The API already returns 202 vs other HTTP errors to indicate failures, which the client should be using to display whether the operation succeeded or failed.'}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2017-09-01 18:58:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

[{'created': '2016-04-07 11:36:39.000000000', 'message': 'Backup create does not return status

When executing backup create API, output does not
contain any status of backup being created.

But as backup create operation is asynchronous operation,
it must show status as creating etc.

This patchset will fix this issue.

Change-Id: Ied10979a29361471746ba37bea68f8ca16c7269d
Closes-Bug:#1567342

commit_message:
Backup create does not return status

When executing backup create API, output does not
contain any status of backup being created.

But as backup create operation is asynchronous operation,
it must show status as creating etc.

This patchset will fix this issue.

APIImpact one more response parameter status added

Closes-Bug:#1567342

Change-Id: Ied10979a29361471746ba37bea68f8ca16c7269d

commit_message:
Update accept_transfer to use volume object

The accept_transfer API is now able to use volume versioned objects.

Note that this patch DOES NOT try to use object dot notation everywhere
to keep the size small. This cleanup will be done in the future.

Change-Id: I593f7117101f37db449676235dabdc6494d8bfc3
Partial-Implements: blueprint cinder-objects

subject: Update logic when creating volume from source

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2016-04-21 08:38:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Cinder allows users to specify a volume type when creating from source volume or snapshot. 

My understanding about _retype_is_possible() is to prevent conflict between volume type and target volume host. As Cinder specifies host of new volume as host of source volume or snapshot: 

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/volume/flows/api/create_volume.py#L760-L774'}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2016-04-21 08:57:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 15961, 'date': '2016-04-21 09:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Another place I think it should be changed: 

https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/cinder/volume/flows/api/create_volume.py#L799

I think it is better to add host to request_spec, and send it to scheduler task. So that scheduler can decide:
1. Whether disabled volume service is used to create volume.
2. Whether there is enough resource in this host.

Any suggestions?'}, {'account_id': 21193, 'date': '2016-04-21 09:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

[{'created': '2016-04-20 06:25:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix of finding out available cinder volume services

Currently when creating a volume from source volume or snapshot,
it should check whether there are only one available cinder-volume

services.

Instead it checks whether there are only one disabled cinder-volume

services. This bug is to fix the problem.

Change-Id: I5c2b5926f4c20e024fb3e8d836ffa020ae4b0cf1
Closes-bug: #1572413

'}, {'created': '2016-07-04 09:35:14.000000000', 'message': 'Fix of finding out available cinder volume services

Currently when creating a volume from source volume or snapshot,
it checks whether backend name of source volume type and target volume
type are same in extra_specs. If same, it allows to create a new volume
from the source volume.

But sometimes there is no backend setting in volume types. The fix is
to allow such case: volume type A has backend setting, there is a volume
in volume type. Volume type B has no backend setting. And users are
going to create a new volume with type B from above volume. In this
scenario, Cinder should allow to create.

In this fix, it checks whether backend of two volume types are same at
first. And then if not same, check whether source.host can be suitable
to target volume type.

Change-Id: I5c2b5926f4c20e024fb3e8d836ffa020ae4b0cf1
Closes-bug: #1572413

commit_message:
Update logic when creating volume from source

Currently when creating a volume from source volume or snapshot,
it checks whether backend name of source volume type and target volume
type are same in extra_specs. If same, it allows to create a new volume
from the source volume.

But sometimes there is no backend setting in volume types. The fix is
to allow such case: volume type A has backend setting, there is a volume
in volume type. Volume type B has no backend setting. And users are
going to create a new volume with type B from above volume. In this
scenario, Cinder should allow to create.

In this fix, it checks whether source.host can be suitable
to target volume type.

Change-Id: I5c2b5926f4c20e024fb3e8d836ffa020ae4b0cf1
Closes-bug: #1572413

(3 comments)

Some comments inline. Besides - when I look at the render [1], I can see that Supports VolumeGroup is true for all the drivers. I think that's incorrect.

Besides that we should add information if driver supports A/A (SUPPORTS_ACTIVE_ACTIVE == True in driver class) and more detailed replication info (Replication 2.1 and A/A replication). I guess we can add that in dependent patch.

Also there's an issue with generic volume groups - basically I don't know how to determine what group capabilities are supported by which driver. E.g. - driver may support generic volume groups regarding group replication, but not consistency groups… I'll add Xing to the review to ask for her opinion on the matter.

Thanks for continuing to work on this. Some comments inline.'}, {'account_id': 170, 'date': '2017-03-06 23:42:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 15:

Karthik, there is an effort in making this a common solution cross projects.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113173.html

Ankur has a proposed common solution: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330027/3

Can we work together on making Cinder's matrix doc use this as well?"}, {'account_id': 11600, 'date': '2017-03-13 08:48:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 19:

Just my $0.02 - the generic approach seems to be using static .ini file to generate the matrix. In this patch a different approach is used - introspection of driver classes and I find this idea superior.

From my perspective it would be best to start with merging our in-house approach and then, once oslosphinx patch is merged, propose support for introspection and move to oslosphinx's solution.

Otherwise I feel we'll unnecessarily delay these efforts in Cinder."}, {'account_id': 20140, 'date': '2017-03-13 16:18:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 21990, 'date': '2017-03-13 16:19:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

 > solution.

Looking at the output [1] there are two things that should be addressed:

1. Volume Migration should be renamed to "Assisted Volume Migration", or removed completely. Basically we have a generic volume migration implemented, so migration itself should work for all of the drivers. Besides that we have driver-specific method that can enhance the migration process and this is what you're checking for.

2. A/A HA support is missing. I mean - we have SUPPORTS_ACTIVE_ACTIVE flag that should get exposed too. Note that this is a different thing than A/A replication, etc.

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-09-15 21:32:37.000000000', 'message': 'Generate support matrix using driver interfaces

Using the ABC classes in cinder.interfaces inspect each driver to
determine what features are implemented and generate a table matrix
using sphinx that users can reference. This work does not complete the
feature-classification but is in support of the eventual goal.

Implements: blueprint feature-classification
Change-Id: If4f7be551e46e7804bf3c99af635c2dd723e5f4f
'}, {'created': '2016-09-16 14:59:44.000000000', 'message': 'Generate support matrix using driver interfaces

commit_message:
Generate support matrix using driver interfaces

Using the ABC classes in cinder.interfaces inspect each driver to
determine what features are implemented and generate a table matrix
using sphinx that users\operators can reference.

Change-Id: If4f7be551e46e7804bf3c99af635c2dd723e5f4f
Co-Authored-By: Karthik Prabhu <karthik.prabhu.vinod@intel.com>

commit_message:
Add snapshots/summary API support

Add a new API to display snapshots summary with total number of snapshots
and total size in GB (total_size: 500 and total_count: 20).

DocImpact
APIImpact
Partially-Implements: blueprint display-volumes-summary-details

Change-Id: I39065488fc39c24d47f84d2848993e86e7e3a3aa
Co-Authored-By: MR Swami Reddy <swamireddy@gmail.com>

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I4c652a85eefa808db7d5e47dcc05ca3bb04388c5

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I4c652a85eefa808db7d5e47dcc05ca3bb04388c5

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 23:18:49.000000000', 'message': 'Add more_info URL to the YAML output

Currently, outputting bandit findings as YAML does not put the
``more_info`` URL in the output as it would if the output format
is HTML or JSON.  This patch set updates the YAML formatter to
include the ``more_info`` URL to be inline with the HTML and JSON
formatters.

Change-Id: Ice134e3bbf67c59feb7a88b299e60838b6ad80d5
Closes-Bug: #1746827
'}]
commit_message:
Add more_info URL to the YAML output

Currently, outputting bandit findings as YAML does not put the
``more_info`` URL in the output as it would if the output format
is HTML or JSON.  This patch set updates the YAML formatter to
include the ``more_info`` URL to be inline with the HTML and JSON
formatters.

Change-Id: Ice134e3bbf67c59feb7a88b299e60838b6ad80d5
Closes-Bug: #1746827

Nova removed several fields from InstanceInfo that were not being
used [1]. This copies our corresponding in-tree driver changes to
the out-of-tree driver.

commit_message:
Trim the fat from InstanceInfo

Nova removed several fields from InstanceInfo that were not being
used [1]. This copies our corresponding in-tree driver changes to
the out-of-tree driver.

I'm basically good with this, although am wondering why one of the fields changed... at least it does not stand out to me at a glance.

Anyway, We've tested this in Ironic's CI jobs, and it enables ironic's multinode grenade to work again. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/535596/ is dependent upon this patch in Ironic, which restores ironic's multinode grenade job to voting status.

For the record, we are working on adding better microversion negotiation to python-ironicclient and those changes are on track to be in the library for this cycle."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-01-20 02:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I like having just two supported version, that we pick between. I also like the capabilities style driver properties to decide what to do in the many body of the code. Long term that seems like a sound approach. Very similar to the cinder approach (although we default to the base version unless needed with cinder, this is kind of the reverse, which I prefer actually).

Its a minor nit for the -1 here really, we report the hypervisor version incorrectly. Seems we should tidy that up.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-01-22 14:34:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@John Garbutt. Which Gods are questioning this, and what/when will they decide? (We need to get our multinode-rolling-upgrades-grenade test working. I am willing to feed them grapes if that helps.)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-01-23 14:00:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

The lack of ability to support n-1 because of microversion locking has bitten ironic and needlessly broken our gates more times than I can count without coffee.

tl;dr we need negotiation to be able to navigate the rigid testing framework when taking into consideration grenade. Of course, this was something Sean Dauge desired that we do this cycle to try and reduce overall headaches because of our weeks long grenade breaks last cycle.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-01-23 14:04:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-12796 : FAILURE in 3h 53m 09s'}, {'account_id': 6125, 'date': '2018-01-23 14:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

zvm:recheck'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2018-01-23 14:16:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

So I think there was a promise (un-written maybe?) to operators that we publish an order services are upgraded, and that should stay fairly stable, get warnings before you are forced to change, etc.

Having said all that, added flexibility around the upgrade seems like a good idea. But now I worry about how we test this extra code path, I guess I am OK with just the unit test coverage given the overhead would be a full new job. Might be nice to see a pass on a modified job though.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-01-23 16:08:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

> So I think there was a promise (un-written maybe?) to operators
 > that we publish an order services are upgraded, and that should
 > stay fairly stable, get warnings before you are forced to change,
 > etc.

Right, so right now we say Ironic should be upgraded before Nova. This patch opens the door to not requiring that. I'm not necessarily opposed to that in principle, although it means we always have to keep moving the points of support in the driver, which is supposed to be the reason we just do ironic first.

My acute problem with this right now, is that we're landing this because we've broken upgrade in the current ordering (because of some dependency upgrade). Instead of fixing that, we're just changing the order to cover up the issue (which may well be with our own test environment). That means (a) we're not testing the procedure in the order we've previously stated was required, (b) we're either changing the order we say things need to happen (which you agree is counter to the consistency that the operators desire) or opening up to multiple orderings, only one if which we'll test, and (c) are eliminating our only case to reproduce the actual issue, which is a pretty severe segv after something gets upgraded which is almost definitely going to bite someone with unified controllers.

Flexibility is cool, but it increases the test matrix. Adding that flexibility so we can change the order to avoid a hard thing is not cool, IMHO. It's hard to test this stuff and make it robust, but constantly redefining the problem to avoid fixing the real problems isn't going to make this robust in the field."}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-01-26 05:44:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Ironic: negotiate microversion to allow downgrade to Pike

This allows Nova to work with the previous version of Ironic. It
attempts to make a single call to the Ironic API at the current
microversion. If that fails, then it falls back to the previous and
assumes it will work. It also only allows passing a configdrive on
rebuild if the latest microversion is supported.

Partial-Bug: #1739440
Change-Id: Id89e37e939b3ed43fb10bc6b4fa23dcbe172fb8d

commit_message:
Add release-type directives for pike

Some projects have updated their release-type for horizon
plugins in queens, but a similar change has not been done
in pike. Rather than waiting for their first stable release
request to fail, adding these changes to those deliverables
to account for these changes.

Change-Id: Ifd51d3dd1d04b1bb11d311fc46f6faf642d432c4

places. Let's consolidate it with a decorator.

commit_message:
Update build to put content into sphinx location

The publication job looks in doc/build/html but we're writing it to
publish/. Update the location ... and also add a success-url to the job
so we can verify the content.

Change-Id: I44de36fcac19a754ec107554b7a300dacd62aa3a

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-02 17:01:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-05 10:26:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-06 16:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Created a revert of this change as I58c9d1bfe49d97a3882a6dd43c9a41a413fe0fab'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 17:01:01.000000000', 'message': "Switch the LXD compute driver test to non-voting

LXD 2.0.11 grew a new feature ('description' tag for a container)
and this has been added to the stable Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 release.
Unfortunately, pylxd 2.2.2 can't handle this extra attribute and
crashes out. This was fixed in pylxd 2.2.4, but has not been ported
to the 2.0.x series.

As such, we switch the test job to non-voting until an upstream
fix is available.

Change-Id: Ia4f1351095023cb90d6491f4dbacaf0288f728c1
Related-Source-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/python-pylxd/+bug/1736454
Related-Bug: #1746068
"}]
commit_message:
Switch the LXD compute driver test to non-voting

LXD 2.0.11 grew a new feature ('description' tag for a container)
and this has been added to the stable Ubuntu Xenial 16.04 release.
Unfortunately, pylxd 2.2.2 can't handle this extra attribute and
crashes out. This was fixed in pylxd 2.2.4, but has not been ported
to the 2.0.x series.

As such, we switch the test job to non-voting until an upstream
fix is available.

Change-Id: Ia4f1351095023cb90d6491f4dbacaf0288f728c1
Related-Source-Bug: https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/python-pylxd/+bug/1736454
Related-Bug: #1746068

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-22 17:19:40.000000000', 'message': 'Use repos variable for the upgrade jobs.

In mixed version setup the repos on the undercloud are set to the
target version tested.  During the upgrade to pike for instance the
repo setup command for the undercloud will be empty as the target
version is not “master” but pike.  This can prevent us to get the
latest packages.

Furthermore it simplify the setup as the target repo are configured in
only one place.

Eventually it will make it matches what is configured for the
overcloud in “overcloud-repo.yaml”.

Change-Id: I7f8a3c226e9b28c9569f771233c5331bd808751c
'}, {'created': '2018-01-23 11:20:31.000000000', 'message': 'Use repos variable for the upgrade jobs.

In mixed version setup the repos on the undercloud are set to the
target version tested.  During the upgrade to pike for instance the
repo setup command for the undercloud will be empty as the target
version is not “master” but pike.  This can prevent us to get the
latest packages.

Furthermore it simplify the setup as the target repo are configured in
only one place.

Eventually it will make it matches what is configured for the
overcloud in “overcloud-repo.yaml”.

Change-Id: I7f8a3c226e9b28c9569f771233c5331bd808751c
'}]
commit_message:
Use repos variable for the upgrade jobs.

In mixed version setup the repos on the undercloud are set to the
target version tested.  During the upgrade to pike for instance the
repo setup command for the undercloud will be empty as the target
version is not “master” but pike.  This can prevent us to get the
latest packages.

Furthermore it simplify the setup as the target repo are configured in
only one place.

Eventually it will make it matches what is configured for the
overcloud in “overcloud-repo.yaml”.

Change-Id: I7f8a3c226e9b28c9569f771233c5331bd808751c

commit_message:
Disable citycloud in nodepool

At the request of Daniel Öhberg, CityNetwork VP of Operations, we
are ceasing booting CI nodes in any remaining regions and pausing
all image uploads for now. We should get back in touch with them
around the beginning of July to find out whether they're ready for
us to reenable use of this account.

Change-Id: I39f12d5a8441b197f5a310c7b33ba42c04c73378

commit_message:
Sort the complete plugin list

Currently the plugin listing found at the link below [1] is unsorted
by bandit ID number, yet the IDs are listed, making it confusing
to look at.

This patch sorts the plugin list by renaming each plugin filename
so that sphinx sorts accordingly.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/bandit/latest/plugins/index.html#complete-test-plugin-listing

subject: Don't install etcd on a compute-only node
messages: [{'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-02-06 16:18:20.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nAbandoned at request of author'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'message': "Don't install etcd on a compute-only node

This is associated with current (and not yet fully reliable)
observations that etcd proxy does not work for reading v3 data.  Hence,
instead of using a local proxy, we should configure Calico everywhere to
speak directly to the etcd server.

Change-Id: Ifdb7214de4632a708c9db2f3a23877ea37dbecbc
"}]
commit_message:
Don't install etcd on a compute-only node

This is associated with current (and not yet fully reliable)
observations that etcd proxy does not work for reading v3 data.  Hence,
instead of using a local proxy, we should configure Calico everywhere to
speak directly to the etcd server.

Change-Id: Ifdb7214de4632a708c9db2f3a23877ea37dbecbc

subject: Capture Felix logging in OpenStack CI runs
messages: [{'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-02-06 16:18:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nAbandoned at request of author'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'message': 'Capture Felix logging in OpenStack CI runs

The OpenStack CI process (devstack-gate) saves off all logs generated by
systemd services that are started with "run_process", but not _all_
services, and so not calico-felix.  But to get the logging from
calico-felix we can use "run_process" to start a secondary service that
just tails Felix's log.  That's what we do here, and the Felix log is
then available in captured logs as a file named
screen-felix-logger.txt.gz.

Change-Id: I40957a3ed4f96a68272a50bcc40303dde770553f
'}]
commit_message:
Capture Felix logging in OpenStack CI runs

The OpenStack CI process (devstack-gate) saves off all logs generated by
systemd services that are started with "run_process", but not _all_
services, and so not calico-felix.  But to get the logging from
calico-felix we can use "run_process" to start a secondary service that
just tails Felix's log.  That's what we do here, and the Felix log is
then available in captured logs as a file named
screen-felix-logger.txt.gz.

Change-Id: I40957a3ed4f96a68272a50bcc40303dde770553f

subject: Build WorkloadEndpoint name as libcalico-go requires
messages: [{'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-02-06 16:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nAbandoned at request of author'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'message': "Build WorkloadEndpoint name as libcalico-go requires

libcalico-go needs the name to conform to the pattern
<host>-<orchestrator>-<workload>-<endpoint> (so that it can map to the
v1 WorkloadEndpointKey without reference to the v3 spec).

(Also Felix needs at least some of those pieces to be correct.  I think
probably <host> and <endpoint>, but haven't fully checked.  So we may as
well make them all exactly match the corresponding spec fields.)

Change-Id: Ife4010d0955529364f96ec1941737b0fd255898a
"}]
commit_message:
Build WorkloadEndpoint name as libcalico-go requires

libcalico-go needs the name to conform to the pattern
<host>-<orchestrator>-<workload>-<endpoint> (so that it can map to the
v1 WorkloadEndpointKey without reference to the v3 spec).

(Also Felix needs at least some of those pieces to be correct.  I think
probably <host> and <endpoint>, but haven't fully checked.  So we may as
well make them all exactly match the corresponding spec fields.)

Change-Id: Ife4010d0955529364f96ec1941737b0fd255898a

subject: Use monotonic_time() for StatusWatcher inactivity logic
messages: [{'account_id': 13734, 'date': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2018-02-06 16:18:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nAbandoned at request of author'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'message': 'Use monotonic_time() for StatusWatcher inactivity logic

I thought time.gmtime() returned a monotonic number of seconds from some
epoch, but in fact it returns a tuple.  monotonic_time() is what we want
here.

Change-Id: Iaaafc0d3b06683829d91d40da3f179b61a9f6d54
'}]
commit_message:
Use monotonic_time() for StatusWatcher inactivity logic

I thought time.gmtime() returned a monotonic number of seconds from some
epoch, but in fact it returns a tuple.  monotonic_time() is what we want
here.

Change-Id: Iaaafc0d3b06683829d91d40da3f179b61a9f6d54

subject: Tell Calico how to access the etcd server
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'message': "Tell Calico how to access the etcd server

Specifically, 127.0.0.1 doesn't work because the devstack-installed etcd
does not listen on that; we need a real IP address.

Change-Id: I0586bf774b59af9ad94e45293506311e4818ef66
"}]
commit_message:
Tell Calico how to access the etcd server

Specifically, 127.0.0.1 doesn't work because the devstack-installed etcd
does not listen on that; we need a real IP address.

Change-Id: I0586bf774b59af9ad94e45293506311e4818ef66

subject: Endpoint handling -> v3 as well as v1
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'message': 'Endpoint handling -> v3 as well as v1

Note that we keep the v1 handling as well, for communication with the
DHCP agent, so as to avoid having to update the DHCP agent code as
well (at least for now).

Change-Id: Ibad03b769342aa9deb1ac0f386957a3158662a6d
'}]
commit_message:
Endpoint handling -> v3 as well as v1

Note that we keep the v1 handling as well, for communication with the
DHCP agent, so as to avoid having to update the DHCP agent code as
well (at least for now).

Change-Id: Ibad03b769342aa9deb1ac0f386957a3158662a6d

subject: Use DevStack etcd install instead of our own
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 16:08:38.000000000', 'message': "Use DevStack etcd install instead of our own

Because there isn't yet a package for etcdv3 in Ubuntu, and our own
install code is package-based and so gives us etcdv2.

Change-Id: Iab145521e73413dd910148693cf8a619764ffe1a
"}]
commit_message:
Use DevStack etcd install instead of our own

Because there isn't yet a package for etcdv3 in Ubuntu, and our own
install code is package-based and so gives us etcdv2.

Change-Id: Iab145521e73413dd910148693cf8a619764ffe1a

Currently, you cannot change configuration options without ironic-conductor restart, so I'm not sure what value this brings."}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2017-05-18 10:31:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Currently, you cannot change configuration options without
 > ironic-conductor restart, so I'm not sure what value this brings.

It is meant here that a network is referred by name, than it is deleted from neutron and recreated with the same name, so there is no need to change the config option in ironic.conf."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-05-18 10:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

- gate-tempest-ironic-ilo-driver-agent_ilo http://15.184.0.52/31/462931/3/check/gate-tempest-ironic-ilo-driver-agent_ilo/d547659 : SUCCESS in 35m 17s
- gate-tempest-ironic-ilo-driver-pxe_ilo http://15.184.0.52/31/462931/3/check/gate-tempest-ironic-ilo-driver-pxe_ilo/37b3a44 : EXCEPTION'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2017-05-23 13:05:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

So I was thinking longer about this patch, and the bug, and I was thinking that making it smarter could be straight forward. My suggestion to do that is that we catch the NetworkNotFoundClient exception from the client, and invalidate the cache if we see that exception, and we could even rerun the command that failed with the fresh UUID (if possible) to prevent breaking a deploy.

*However*, I also think that all the logic around caching this stuff is going to change when https://review.openstack.org/#/c/460564 goes ahead because we'll most likely need to cache the UUIDs in the driver_internal_info field, or as the current patch does it, remove caching anyway.

Taking a quick look to see how straight forward it would be to add an additional try: except NetworkNotFoundClient: into our neutron code to invalidate the cache also made me realise how sharded our neutron client logic is which makes it quite difficult to implement common code for handling this particular exception.

For reference the neutron error that I think we need to catch is here: https://github.com/openstack/python-neutronclient/blob/master/neutronclient/common/exceptions.py#L141"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-05-23 15:23:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

@Sam. Would it make sense to do the following then:

1. land this patch (and lose the caching)
2. land https://review.openstack.org/#/c/460564
3. enhance the code to cache?

Note that I haven't looked at #2; I'm asking the above based on your comment.

I'm not exactly sure how 'high' this bug is. One work around is to restart the conductor (not desirable I know); or avoid using named networks. Alternative is to address this after patch (#2 above) lands? Might be other alternatives for those that are familiar with both patches :)"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-06 15:33:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-2

This has been superceded by 78e689e5390acf0d18b433c05495628012466c61.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-06 15:33:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Not needed since it was fixed by 78e689e5390acf0d18b433c05495628012466c61'}]

commit_message:
Ironic conductor works correctly on changes of networks

Now ,if provisioning/cleaning network is changed, Ironic conductor
behave correctly. Removed the conductor caching of provisioning/
cleaning network uuid. Now ironic conductor will pick up the
details each and  every time.

Change-Id: I38e563531832a524880b0484d755a71642896689
Closes-Bug: #1679260
