commit_message:
mongodb: avoid duplicated resources in systemd config

The unit directory for mongodb service in systemd is already managed by
puppet-systemd. This patch will ensure that puppet-tripleo doesn't
manage the resource anymore and actually rely on it for orchestration
with a "require" statement.

Change-Id: Id030896250117dcc0eb6c4f5a7b8d8aa4d265fa5
Closes-Bug: #1747533
(cherry picked from commit 961a6fd0d4963853d1ee25e6faeed10fbf16f730)

Given this behavior depends on which vif type you're using and that we're operating on a stale nw info cache, I think not waiting on the vif plugged events is OK, but we should update the comments and not copy them from finish_migration() since they are mostly just confusing, at least to me. I think this could be made more reliable if we (1) waited for a network-vif-unplugged event and (2) refreshed the instance.info_cache before going to _create_domain_and_network to figure out which vifs to wait for, but I don't think we need to do that in this change since we have to backport this."}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-02-02 16:11:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/540168/2/ : FAILURE in 14s'}, {'account_id': 7166, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:14:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:43:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Sure, I don't have a better alternative. Sounds like we don't even get a network-changed event in the case of the reboot so we can't rely on that either and then refresh the info cache to at least know which vifs are not active.

Also, this is probably not something someone would hit outside of our CI environment where the tests are creating an instance and then immediately hard rebooting it. From digging through the logs, we see the instance go active and after that, but before (or while) the reboot is happening, we see what seem to be random network-changed and network-vif-plugged events, which could also change the results of the info cache we're using. Not great to remove this, since I think in real life we should be able to wait for vif-plugged events here, and that apparently works OK for OVS at least, but LB is different and therefore we don't have a reliable way to wait for the correct thing, so until someone has a better idea, we just won't wait since we could be wrong."}, {'account_id': 10135, 'date': '2018-02-02 23:42:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/pike as commit 83ffc76edd360929925fc4bb66e5dcbf8254a30e'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-02-06 14:49:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-01 22:30:10.000000000', 'message': "Don't wait for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

Because we unplug vifs locally, the change may go undetected by the
neutron agent or server, so neutron may not know the vif was unplugged
in the first place and may never send a plug event.

Closes-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4
"}, {'created': '2018-02-02 17:20:15.000000000', 'message': "Don't wait for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

Originally, in change Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986 we
added a re-initialization of volumes, encryptors, and vifs to hard
reboot. When creating the libvirt domain and network, we were waiting
for vif plug events from neutron when we replugged the vifs. Then, we
started seeing timeouts in the linuxbridge gate job because compute
was timing out waiting for plug events from neutron during a hard
reboot.

It turns out that the behavior of neutron plug events depends on what
vif type we're using and we're also using a stale network info_cache
throughout the hard reboot code path, so we can't be 100% sure we know
which vifs to wait for plug events from anyway. We coincidentally get
some info_cache refreshes from network-changed events from neutron,
but we shouldn't rely on that.

Ideally, we could do something like wait for an unplug event after we
unplug the vif, then refresh the network_info cache, then wait for the
plug event. BUT, in the case of the os-vif linuxbridge unplug method,
it is a no-op, so I don't think we could expect to get an unplug
event for it (and we don't see any network-vif-unplugged events sent
in the q-svc log for the linuxbridge job during a hard reboot).

Closes-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4
"}]
commit_message:
Don't wait for vif plug events during _hard_reboot

Originally, in change Id188d48609f3d22d14e16c7f6114291d547a8986 we
added a re-initialization of volumes, encryptors, and vifs to hard
reboot. When creating the libvirt domain and network, we were waiting
for vif plug events from neutron when we replugged the vifs. Then, we
started seeing timeouts in the linuxbridge gate job because compute
was timing out waiting for plug events from neutron during a hard
reboot.

It turns out that the behavior of neutron plug events depends on what
vif type we're using and we're also using a stale network info_cache
throughout the hard reboot code path, so we can't be 100% sure we know
which vifs to wait for plug events from anyway. We coincidentally get
some info_cache refreshes from network-changed events from neutron,
but we shouldn't rely on that.

Ideally, we could do something like wait for an unplug event after we
unplug the vif, then refresh the network_info cache, then wait for the
plug event. BUT, in the case of the os-vif linuxbridge unplug method,
it is a no-op, so I don't think we could expect to get an unplug
event for it (and we don't see any network-vif-unplugged events sent
in the q-svc log for the linuxbridge job during a hard reboot).

Closes-Bug: #1744361

Change-Id: Ib0cf5d55750f13d0499a570f14024dca551ed4d4

commit_message:
i18n: Annotate template generator django template properly

Strings in Django template for the template generator was previously
annotated using angular-gettext syntax, but this is Djnago temaplate.
Djnago templates need to be annotated in the Django i18n way [1].

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/topics/i18n/translation/#internationalization-in-template-code

Change-Id: I094fd3ab1c59bb1f96e713a70054cc5b99898974
Partial-Bug: #1747302

commit_message:
Generate HostnameMap with quickstart interface

... and not config-download.yaml.j2 in tripleo-quickstart-extras.
That way, we can get rid of HostnameMap in config-download.yaml.j2
which is only working with one subnode, and we can make it work for any
architecture thanks to the quickstart interface.

Change-Id: I21b151b6bba8f84afff441078b4762453c6a091c

messages:
[{'account_id': 10061, 'date': '2018-02-01 18:56:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10061, 'date': '2018-02-02 00:53:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19853, 'date': '2018-02-02 02:16:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

nit update, please'}, {'account_id': 10061, 'date': '2018-02-02 14:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11762, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:31:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10061, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:34:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> (1 comment)

It was assumed that this was causing performance issues, however I don't think that is the case. 

You are correct it is a empty list."}, {'account_id': 11762, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:41:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi Joe, ok, thanks for confirming. So it is not needed. Shall we abandon it?'}, {'account_id': 10061, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:45:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

> Hi Joe, ok, thanks for confirming. So it is not needed. Shall we
 > abandon it?

I would like someone more familiar with the networking-ovn to weigh in that is closer to the project than I. @Lucas/@Daniel? 

There is a performance impact when it comes to port-creation compared to ovsml2, so we are trying to pinpoint things now. 

I'll -1 the WF for now."}, {'account_id': 10061, 'date': '2018-02-02 21:48:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > Hi Joe, ok, thanks for confirming. So it is not needed. Shall we
 > > abandon it?
 > 
 > I would like someone more familiar with the networking-ovn to weigh
 > in that is closer to the project than I. @Lucas/@Daniel?
 > 
 > There is a performance impact when it comes to port-creation
 > compared to ovsml2, so we are trying to pinpoint things now.
 > 
 > I'll -1 the WF for now.
@Han - The thought was hitting the ACL code path caused the slow down.

I have tried this patch to see if it helped and didn't see a drastic improvement."}, {'account_id': 10061, 'date': '2018-02-05 22:10:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: -Workflow

Hey Han - So I did some more testing --

Here are my findings:
northd utilization with my patch : https://snapshot.raintank.io/dashboard/snapshot/ROkxH3fkWd6LXLR6wXNExmHbGWxKWOD5?orgId=2 

northd utilization without my patch: https://snapshot.raintank.io/dashboard/snapshot/dwbhn0Z1zVTh9kI5j6mCVySx8TvrP45m

Having this path would save about 40-50% CPU.'}, {'account_id': 11762, 'date': '2018-02-06 00:00:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

The result is interesting, but it doesn't justify the code change, and I am not sure how to explain the result. If there is no security groups attached to the port, it should have no difference. Do you have anything special in your set-up? Do you have security-group or not for this testing?

Please be noticed that port-security and security-groups are different features, although Neutron API should prevent you from adding security-groups when port-security is disabled."}, {'account_id': 10061, 'date': '2018-02-06 00:10:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> The result is interesting, but it doesn't justify the code change,

I don’t agree. But, I do think we need to figure out why ACLs cause this much CPU overhead. Disabling ACL isn’t a good solution overall. 

 > and I am not sure how to explain the result. If there is no
 > security groups attached to the port, it should have no difference.
 > Do you have anything special in your set-up? Do you have
 > security-group or not for this testing?

In both cases firewall driver is noop and I removed port_security. 

 > 
 > Please be noticed that port-security and security-groups are
 > different features, although Neutron API should prevent you from
 > adding security-groups when port-security is disabled."}, {'account_id': 11762, 'date': '2018-02-06 00:41:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Joe, thanks for explain. So you mean you have security-groups attached to the port but disabled port-security? If yes, then it explains the test result.

However, this is not the right fix because as I mentioned earlier, port-security is a different feature from security-group. Port-security is about preventing traffic with faked IP/MAC to/from the port, and security-group is about a group of security-rules. (I think I was wrong about Neutron API preventing us from attaching security-groups to port when port-security is disabled)

The real problem you reported is in fact slowness of security-group implementation. You may report a new bug for improving performance of security-group implementation, although it is not going to be an easy fix.'}, {'account_id': 10061, 'date': '2018-02-06 00:55:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Joe, thanks for explain. So you mean you have security-groups
 > attached to the port but disabled port-security? If yes, then it
 > explains the test result.

I did not have attach any security groups, unless there is a default one attached?

 > 
 > However, this is not the right fix because as I mentioned earlier,
 > port-security is a different feature from security-group.
 > Port-security is about preventing traffic with faked IP/MAC to/from
 > the port, and security-group is about a group of security-rules. (I
 > think I was wrong about Neutron API preventing us from attaching
 > security-groups to port when port-security is disabled)
 > 
 > The real problem you reported is in fact slowness of security-group
 > implementation. You may report a new bug for improving performance
 > of security-group implementation, although it is not going to be an
 > easy fix.'}, {'account_id': 11762, 'date': '2018-02-06 01:02:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> I did not have attach any security groups, unless there is a default one attached?

Yes, default group should be there if you didn't disable it purposely. You can verify by "openstack port show <port>" or "neutron port-show <port>".'}, {'account_id': 10061, 'date': '2018-02-06 13:46:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> > I did not have attach any security groups, unless there is a
 > default one attached?
 > 
 > Yes, default group should be there if you didn't disable it
 > purposely. You can verify by "openstack port show <port>" or
 > "neutron port-show <port>".

Ok - yes the sg is there :
(.browbeat-venv) (overcloud) [stack@lorenzo results]$ openstack port show bf6820ba-4459-45cb-92d0-f846d87a3c2d

commit_message:
Enable IPv6 scenario tests in Upstream CI

This change complements the work of preceding IPv6 scenario
test changes [1,2] by enabling the settings that allow the tests
to be run in the Upstream CI.

[1] I4ca727f92618998242af18908bbbda6bb5f86303
[2] Id8b005cdd429d53a75624885fe7ca795746c3ede

Change-Id: I705b7d9cbc14d4bbc4d89b4c343205908758a5cb
Depends-on: Id8b005cdd429d53a75624885fe7ca795746c3ede
Depends-on: I4ca727f92618998242af18908bbbda6bb5f86303

subject: Fix masakari query remote node state
messages:
[{'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2017-10-31 10:11:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2017-10-31 10:13:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2017-11-01 05:01:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2017-11-01 05:04:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Hi samP and rikimaru,

I have proposed this patch for fixing the bug #1728527. We will check the remote node state via crm_mon instead of old cibadmin --query method.

This is a WIP, ideally we should use one method (maybe only crm_mon) instead of mixing both crm and cibadmin.

Please review and give comments.'}, {'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2017-11-01 06:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2017-11-01 09:40:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hi Hieu,

Thank you for creating this patch.
I check this.'}, {'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2017-11-01 11:10:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2017-11-08 09:22:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> We will check the remote node state via crm_mon instead of old cibadmin --query method.
> This is a WIP, ideally we should use one method (maybe only crm_mon) instead of mixing both crm and cibadmin.

Hi Hieu,

I thought that this patch is generally good, but please check my comment about the replacement to crm_mon. This comment is just suggestion so I don't score.

Originally, the info that hostmonitor gets by cibadmin is as follow three.
#1: Node status (No RemoteNode info)
#2: Whether the cluster has a quorum
#3: IPMI info that set in params of stonith's ipmi RA

Using the crm_mon --as-xml command, we can get #1 (with RemoteNode info) and #2. But we can't get #3.
Therefore, I think it's impossible to replace all of #1, #2 and #3 with only crm_mon command.
As for #1 and #2, I think that is good to use crm_mon as your suggestion.
As for #3, we can get #3 by combining crm_mon and crm_resource commands. However, since its two step is troublesom, I think that it is better to use cibadmin command as usual."}, {'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2017-11-09 08:38:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> 
 > Hi Hieu,
 > 
 > I thought that this patch is generally good, but please check my
 > comment about the replacement to crm_mon. This comment is just
 > suggestion so I don't score.
 > 
 > Originally, the info that hostmonitor gets by cibadmin is as follow
 > three.
 > #1: Node status (No RemoteNode info)
 > #2: Whether the cluster has a quorum
 > #3: IPMI info that set in params of stonith's ipmi RA
 > 
 > Using the crm_mon --as-xml command, we can get #1 (with RemoteNode
 > info) and #2. But we can't get #3.
 > Therefore, I think it's impossible to replace all of #1, #2 and #3
 > with only crm_mon command.
 > As for #1 and #2, I think that is good to use crm_mon as your
 > suggestion.
 > As for #3, we can get #3 by combining crm_mon and crm_resource
 > commands. However, since its two step is troublesom, I think that
 > it is better to use cibadmin command as usual.

Thanks Takahara,

So I will push a new patch regarding replace #1 and #2 with crm_mon and keep #3 with cibadmin, is this OK?"}, {'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2017-11-10 03:03:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> So I will push a new patch regarding replace #1 and #2 with crm_mon and keep #3 with cibadmin, is this OK?
Hi Hieu,
Yes, that's fine."}, {'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2017-11-13 03:04:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2017-11-15 07:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)

> #2: Whether the cluster has a quorum

I have a comment about how to get #2.
Please check my comment.'}, {'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2017-11-29 04:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2017-11-29 04:25:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2017-12-01 05:48:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

Thanks Hieu,
I made several comments, so please confirm them.'}, {'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2017-12-06 09:36:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2017-12-06 09:36:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23226, 'date': '2017-12-07 04:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

Thanks Hieu, LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 19741, 'date': '2018-01-10 06:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

hi, is there any update?'}, {'account_id': 8988, 'date': '2018-01-11 00:42:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Sorry for the delay in reviewing.

I review this patch, and I'll talk about this patch in the next IRC meeting."}, {'account_id': 26026, 'date': '2018-02-06 13:22:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

minor comment'}]

commit_message:
Fix masakari query remote node state

This fix intend to use crm_mon instead of cibadmin for querying
remote node state.

Change-Id: Id5b946a2e09aa10617f8b832d7aad410c4123319
Closes-Bug: #1728527

commit_message:
Add nova_notifications flag

This change allows enabling the nova vm state notifications
without the requirement to enable either of ceilometer, designate
or searchlight.

Change-Id: I172c0c0d9ac1c4e42d622b2a80b9fb13e3d4101c

commit_message:
Bump ovsdbapp u-c to 0.9.1

The new ovsdbapp version contains a fix for critical bug 1741889. It
would be great to start testing it before RC cut and include such
version to Q release.

Change-Id: Id687fad23c050ec003edb3ca9acee8380b9035d9
Related-bug: #1741889

I understand maintaining it could be difficult, but unless upstream UT framework is revamped somehow, I don't see a way around."}, {'account_id': 12826, 'date': '2018-02-06 12:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
Add N1Kv functionality to VM launch

As part of the core-vendor decomposition of horizon, cisco n1kv
specific code in VM launch would be removed from upstream
horizon. This patch adds that functionality back by extending
upstream classes related to VM launch with n1kv code.

It also adds back the unit tests related to launch instance
that will be removed with the main functionality from upstream
horizon.

Change-Id: Iadfc47683364193257cc210de28e7f98dd2e5a2c
Closes-Bug: 1492082

We need to remove following from overrides.py file

horizon_network_workflows.CreateNetwork._create_network = \
    cisco_network_workflows.DFACreateNetwork._create_network

Because of this line it tries to find _create_network function in
workflows.py but it won;t find it because we are using Parent's
_create_network function

Change-Id: I71cf399c82542e69eb5cfacba6642d81ed3ec353
Implements: Fixes Create Network Functionality
Closes-Bug: #1687489
"}]
commit_message:
Remove _create_network override code

We need to remove following from overrides.py file

horizon_network_workflows.CreateNetwork._create_network = \
    cisco_network_workflows.DFACreateNetwork._create_network

Because of this line it tries to find _create_network function in
workflows.py but it won;t find it because we are using Parent's
_create_network function

Change-Id: I71cf399c82542e69eb5cfacba6642d81ed3ec353
Implements: Fixes Create Network Functionality
Closes-Bug: #1687489

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-25 05:16:24.000000000', 'message': 'Make workflow execution creation idempotent

Change-Id: I1f650efbd23b00298a30e16893ca4f18d87c99b3
'}, {'created': '2017-12-25 06:35:38.000000000', 'message': 'Make workflow execution creation idempotent

Change-Id: I1f650efbd23b00298a30e16893ca4f18d87c99b3
'}, {'created': '2017-12-25 07:52:25.000000000', 'message': 'Make workflow execution creation idempotent

Implements blueprint: mistral-idempotent-execution-create

Change-Id: I1f650efbd23b00298a30e16893ca4f18d87c99b3
'}, {'created': '2017-12-25 09:45:23.000000000', 'message': 'Make workflow execution creation idempotent

* Made workflow execution creation idempotent. We can now
  pass an execution ID which is used when creating a new
  execution object. If the object with this ID doesn't exist,
  then a new execution is created and this ID is assigned to,
  and also the corresponding workflow gets started normally.
  If the object exists then the endpoint just returns
  properties of this object in JSON w/o starting the workflow.
  If an execution ID is not passed then the endpoint works as
  before, so it is backwards compatible with the previous
  version.
* Added unit tests to check all possible logic branches
  depending on whether we passed an execution ID.
* Had to add "wf_ex_id" paramter to the "start_workflow"
  method of the Engine API and fix all relevant calls.
* Other minor changes.

Implements blueprint: mistral-idempotent-execution-create

Change-Id: I1f650efbd23b00298a30e16893ca4f18d87c99b3

* Had to add "wf_ex_id" paramter to the "start_workflow"
  method of the Engine API and fix all relevant calls.
* Other minor style changes.

Implements blueprint: mistral-idempotent-execution-create

Change-Id: I1f650efbd23b00298a30e16893ca4f18d87c99b3
'}]
commit_message:
Make workflow execution creation idempotent

* Made workflow execution creation idempotent. We can now
  pass an execution ID which is used when creating a new
  execution object. If the object with this ID doesn't exist,
  then a new execution is created and this ID is assigned to,
  and also the corresponding workflow gets started normally.
  If the object exists then the endpoint just returns
  properties of this object in JSON w/o starting the workflow.
  If an execution ID is not passed then the endpoint works as
  before, so it is backwards compatible with the previous
  version.
* Added unit tests to check all possible logic branches
  depending on whether we passed an execution ID.
* Had to add "wf_ex_id" paramter to the "start_workflow"
  method of the Engine API and fix all relevant calls.
* Other minor style changes.

Implements blueprint: mistral-idempotent-execution-create

Change-Id: I1f650efbd23b00298a30e16893ca4f18d87c99b3

commit_message:
Remove the unsupported 'insecure_registry' for >=docker 3.0.0

The argument of 'insecure_registry' for image push has been removed
by this commit (in docker 3.0.0):
https://github.com/docker/docker-py/commit/b180b8770a265e33099bd6da76c3e556a1028491

Actually this argument was marked as deprecated and unfunctional
before this removing.

This commit is to remove this parameter at invoking the push() function
when docker version >= 3.0.0.

Change-Id: Ifa7d304d08a4073dcb1dff751d5a443c112cd377
Closes-Bug: #1746703

The current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html" does not

Closes-Bug: #1747453
'}]
commit_message:
Correct django template pattern in babel-django.cfg

The current recommended file pattern "templates/**.html" does not
match Django templates in subdirectories.
This needs to be "**/templates/**.html".

Change-Id: I7414e9d973be98e5ee6d6277cf750ded40bc6c7a
Closes-Bug: #1747453

commit_message:
Remove project name from Zuul

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I7f636e09f63e54da58abe029d5398e860c78c3a0

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 24502, 'date': '2018-02-05 12:48:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Only run map_instances for Ocata

map_instances only needs to be run during the transition from
Newton to Ocata to map existing instances into a cell. All
new Ocata instances will be automatically mapped to a call.
This change limits the slow running map_instances command to
just run for upgrades to Ocata

Change-Id: Ic2e2df530504284d28cfcab26a71d211342203fa
Closes-Bug: #1743357

commit_message:
Add warning about DeploymentServerBlacklist

Despite the existing language, there seems to be some confusion on
whether or not DeploymentServerBlacklist applies to all deployments.

Add a clearer warning.

Change-Id: I9fd2656eb398a4624288b06c414eb98da9c8f260
Closes-Bug: #1747502

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-18 09:08:15.000000000', 'message': 'Remove die-on-term in uwsgi config

This removes setting die-on-term in uwsgi config: it prevents the
services from stopping cleanly instead relying on the SIGKILL after a
timeout.

Change-Id: Ic4a404f5c6e51ae0fd3dd5ef9abfb7ff445d887b
Closes-Bug: #1724497
'}]
commit_message:
Remove die-on-term in uwsgi config

This removes setting die-on-term in uwsgi config: it prevents the
services from stopping cleanly instead relying on the SIGKILL after a
timeout.

Change-Id: Ic4a404f5c6e51ae0fd3dd5ef9abfb7ff445d887b
Closes-Bug: #1724497

Not answering for those directly involved, but it seems like the steps necessary to meet the goal have been implemented and so it can be marked complete (even if they resulted in some lingering cleanup work which remains incomplete at the moment).'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-01-09 22:39:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-01-22 23:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-02-02 10:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Technically yes, but we have a lot of preparatory work still left.
 > We need to work on removing remaining tempest bits in neutron tree;
 > there is some job setup work to do. How do we track it? Is it ok to
 > mark this as done while those tasks are not complete?

The bundled tempest plugin is removed from neutron and jobs were moved to use new newly tempest plugin against neutron project. Stadium projects coming under Neutron team are also consuming the same. The plan was to merge the bundled tempest plugin of stadium project into neutron tempest plugin. I donot have the status on that.
@Ihar, But as a part of tempest plugin split goal, for neutron project it is done. Do we have to wait for removing stadium project to mark the completion?'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-02-02 14:50:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-02-02 19:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-06 08:49:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

subject: Guestagent init wrong Mongodb config item
messages:
[{'account_id': 27577, 'date': '2018-01-03 08:34:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25113, 'date': '2018-01-03 09:23:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Looks like this item is one default value of MongoDB's configuration. According to the doc [1], “The Linux package init scripts do not expect processManagement.fork to change from the defaults.” So I was wondering that if we can add this into trove/templates/mongodb/config.template.  I'm not sure. We can discuss about that. :)

[1].https://docs.mongodb.com/manual/reference/configuration-options/#processManagement.fork"}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-01-05 05:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The root cause should be explained. From the offical docuement Fan Zhang mentioned, the default value of "processManagement.fork" is False and should be no problem with the official linux package init scripts. So this problem may be only related to the daemon controlling process (systemd or upstart ) of some specific guest image?'}, {'account_id': 24739, 'date': '2018-01-06 08:45:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

 > controlling process (systemd or upstart ) of some specific guest
 > image?

commit_message:
Guestagent init wrong Mongodb config item

Guestagent apply wrong config item for Mongodb, for Mongodb v3.2/3.0,
processManagement.fork must set be True, otherwise it starts failed.

Change-Id: Ia67bec903c8f207a1f5e226ec77e0583756b4f77

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 10:13:17.000000000', 'message': 'Improve console install and restart services appropriately

The current implementation wipes out the novnc/spice directory
every single time the playbook executes. While it does replace
it afterwards it does not fire a notifier to make the service
restart, resulting in the service failing.

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

This should ensure that novnc/spice restart properly on upgrades
and that there are no changes/restarts for the service if the git
SHA or software does not change.

Closes-Bug: #1746523
Change-Id: Ic39f884016a6ba0498110267027783001a087a1c
(cherry picked from commit c41103ba702cd6fd85d8e4d4fe86caef81623f44)

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

This should ensure that novnc/spice restart properly on upgrades
and that there are no changes/restarts for the service if the git

The 'Manage LB' handler notification is removed as it is not

commit_message:
Improve console install and restart services appropriately

The current implementation wipes out the novnc/spice directory
every single time the playbook executes. While it does replace
it afterwards it does not fire a notifier to make the service
restart, resulting in the service failing.

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

This should ensure that novnc/spice restart properly on upgrades
and that there are no changes/restarts for the service if the git
SHA or software does not change.

Backport note:
The 'Manage LB' handler notification is removed as it is not
present in pike.

Closes-Bug: #1746523
Change-Id: Ic39f884016a6ba0498110267027783001a087a1c
(cherry picked from commit c41103ba702cd6fd85d8e4d4fe86caef81623f44)

designate bind allow notify from workers

from designate workers.

Closes-Bug: 1740455

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ie83e523146f514a6107a9ee8f8d4d6477c811384

Add the 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header
in the request of PUT in SchedulerReportClient.

(microversion 1.5 not available) and ensuring
a resource class, the header is added.

commit_message:
[placement] Add sending global request ID in put (1)

Add the 'X-Openstack-Request-Id' header
in the request of PUT in SchedulerReportClient.
When updating inventories, deleting inventories
(microversion 1.5 not available) and ensuring
a resource class, the header is added.

Subsequent patches will add the header in the other cases.

Change-Id: I02b9f2ef1cbd16d5bf9c4084bc652e94875a6c2a
Partial-Bug: #1734625

subject: partitioner: do not use hash() to determine object identity
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 08:48:02.000000000', 'message': "partitioner: do not use hash() to determine object identity

The `hash` method is random on Python\xa03, so it's not consistent between. Just
use the string representation of the object as a default.

Closes-Bug: #1743243
(cherry picked from commit 62fd552e1e1f40e265e3bf781170b21bfb5f4626)

Change-Id: Ic27c0203f629f0260a9ae5758762114488f9b4d0
"}]
commit_message:
partitioner: do not use hash() to determine object identity

The `hash` method is random on Python 3, so it's not consistent between. Just
use the string representation of the object as a default.

Closes-Bug: #1743243
(cherry picked from commit 62fd552e1e1f40e265e3bf781170b21bfb5f4626)

Change-Id: Ic27c0203f629f0260a9ae5758762114488f9b4d0

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I2383c86763c6e02bb494b11c0a53ab0462f1d475

commit_message:
Correct location of venv build logs

In [1] the intent was to have each venv build log
to its own log file. This makes troubleshooting a
lot easier due to the verbosity of the output in
the log - this at least separates each venv's
output. Unfortunately this extra CLI option was
supposed to be removed. This patch completes the
original intent.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/470757

Change-Id: I714d160a39beb870ba66db11a60cf0241ca770f3
(cherry picked from commit 12611a94408421daecdb7daad18ba857cbaba794)

commit_message:
Correct location of venv build logs

In [1] the intent was to have each venv build log
to its own log file. This makes troubleshooting a
lot easier due to the verbosity of the output in
the log - this at least separates each venv's
output. Unfortunately this extra CLI option was
supposed to be removed. This patch completes the
original intent.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/470757

Change-Id: I714d160a39beb870ba66db11a60cf0241ca770f3
(cherry picked from commit 12611a94408421daecdb7daad18ba857cbaba794)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I731396f4bb8d7477da2cf2ac6b62dd58647edab9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-09 16:38:42.000000000', 'message': 'Tempest Neutron test cases for create_port, list_ports and update_port are falied

The test cases are failed for multi node environment because while create a port with "binding:host_id"
for single node host_id can be get with

        cls.host_id = socket.gethostname()

But if compute node is separate then need to get the host_id of the compute where port can be bind.

To get the test case running need host_id to update "binding:host_id"

        cls.host_id = cls.hyper_client.list_hypervisors()['hypervisors'][0]['hypervisor_hostname']

This will work with both single and multi node environment.

Closes-Bug: #1742096

Change-Id: I943150845fa05f24566ea0cd282306136688039b
'}, {'created': '2018-01-10 13:46:15.000000000', 'message': 'Tempest Neutron test cases for create_port, list_ports and update_port are falied

The test cases are failed for multi node environment because while create a port with "binding:host_id"
for single node host_id can be get with

        cls.host_id = socket.gethostname()

But if compute node is separate then need to get the host_id of the compute where port can be bind.

To get the test case running need host_id to update "binding:host_id"

This will work with both single and multi node environment.

Closes-Bug: #1742096

The test cases are failed for multi node environment because while create a port with "binding:host_id"

'}, {'created': '2018-01-23 09:25:18.000000000', 'message': 'Neutron test cases create,list,update port failed

while running test case over neutron plugin(contrail) with dpdk/sriov
computes, host_id in "binding:host_id" should be compute node name.so
that port can be allocated to a given compute host.

Here we are using "cls.host_id = socket.hostname()" which return
hostname of tempest host.Vrouter will looking for compute node
with tempest hostname to bind port there but didn't found any compute
node with tempest hostname.So raised an exception.

Details: {u'message': u'bad virtual_machine_interface request:
internal error: virtual router default-global-system-config:openstack
not found', u'type': u'badrequest', u'detail': u''}

To get test case running host_id should be compute node name.

Hyper_list = cls.hyper_client.list_hypervisors()
cls.host_id = hyper_list['hypervisors'][0]['hypervisor_hostname']

closes-bug: #1742096

Change-Id: I943150845fa05f24566ea0cd282306136688039b
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron test cases create,list,update port failed

while running test case over neutron plugin(contrail) with dpdk/sriov
computes, host_id in "binding:host_id" should be compute node name.so
that port can be allocated to a given compute host.

Here we are using "cls.host_id = socket.hostname()" which return
hostname of tempest host.Vrouter will looking for compute node
with tempest hostname to bind port there but didn't found any compute
node with tempest hostname.So raised an exception.

Details: {u'message': u'bad virtual_machine_interface request:
internal error: virtual router default-global-system-config:openstack
not found', u'type': u'badrequest', u'detail': u''}

To get test case running host_id should be compute node name.

Hyper_list = cls.hyper_client.list_hypervisors()
cls.host_id = hyper_list['hypervisors'][0]['hypervisor_hostname']

closes-bug: #1742096

Change-Id: I943150845fa05f24566ea0cd282306136688039b

commit_message:
INFINIDAT: support deleting datasets with snapshots

Deleting a share or a snapshot from the INFINDIAT InfiniBox should
support a case where the share or snapshot has snapshots that were
created externally (i.e. through the InfiniBox interface).

Change-Id: Ic9d03493283c573506330a620fa21516bbd09c26
Closes-Bug: #1746439

when page is loaded from bfcache, so back button will work

[1] https://madhatted.com/2013/6/16/you-do-not-understand-browser-history

commit_message:
Fix back button on Firefox and Safari

Firefox (and Safari) uses bfcache (back-forward cache)
to load re-visited pages. The solution is to force a reload
when page is loaded from bfcache, so back button will work
correctly.
More information can be found here [1] and here [2].

[1] https://madhatted.com/2013/6/16/you-do-not-understand-browser-history
[2] https://stackoverflow.com/questions/8788802/prevent-safari-loading-from-cache-when-back-button-is-clicked

Change-Id: If023bca7c73f983e55c383856e304379c7b8be3a
Closes-bug: #1686315
(cherry picked from commit 7b45b7ae4b175afdfdb512ed87f425cc4f402f51)

commit_message:
Remove bundled intree ceileometer tempest plugin

* All the telemetry related projects intree tempest plugins
  are now moved to telemetry-tempest-plugin

Change-Id: I57738964f65495364dcc74821634d54aea1769fd

messages:
[{'account_id': 27566, 'date': '2018-02-05 11:12:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-05 11:12:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
